Title:
Morphological and phylogenetic characterisation of Endophytic
fungi associated with the Grape flowers
Keywords:
Alternaria, Cladosporium, Diaporthe, Epicoccum, new host,
new species
Abstract:
Grape flower is the ultimate harvest from grapevine either
to utilize as fresh fruit or wine. Hence it is important to identify the
fungi associated with the flowering stage and their potential for
infecting berries. In the present study, endophytic fungi were isolated
from the calyptra of the grape flower. In total 97 isolates were
obtained from four different grape cultivars. We identified that those
isolates were belonging to four genera namely Alternaria, Cladosporium,
Diaporthe and Epicoccum. The most abundant genus was Alternaria with 88
Alternaria alternata isolates. Four Cladosporium species were identified
including two new host records (Cladosporium ramotenellum and
Cladosporium anthropophilum) and one new species (Cladosporium
endophytica). In addition to that Diaporthe eres and a novel Epicoccum
species (Epicoccum endophytica) were identified. This study provides
basic biological evidence that some of the fruit disease pathogens can
exist as endophytes from the flowering stage. These results will be an
addition to the current knowledge of grape pathogens and thus to develop
sustainable management strategies
